comments: I had him last semester for juvenile delinquency. There are five exams over the terms and names of people in the book. As long as you study those you will do fine. He does offer a paper in exchange for your lowest test grade if you need to. I really enjoyed his lectures. He made the class interesting and knows what he is talking about. Great class

I really enjoyed Dr. Sullins. He is very engaging and enjoys teaching Juvenile Delinquency. He also works in the field, so the dude knows what he is talking about. Lectures are solid. He keeps your attention. Know the terms (50) and you will pass tests (5) with no problem. He is more than willing to help you understand. Lots of stories and humor.

I took him for criminology and he is the kinda of teacher that wants to have discussions. You don\'t have to talk but it is encouraged. All his test are off the terms in the chapters and a few people. Its all memorization, so its not hard at all. He also helps you to reschedule if you can\'t make it to the test. Awesome Professor!

I took him for Juvenile Delinquency over the summer. His class was very interesting and he likes to make sure that the students talk during class, his lectures are very interesting! The tests were easy, they were based off terms and people in the book. He\'ll work with you if you can\'t make it on test days. Very nice guy!

He is a great professor! I was moderately interested in the class and after taking him I have considered a job with delinquents. There is a lot of discussion and everything is from the book. He tests the key terms and over people mentioned in the text. Tests every 3 weeks.
Great teacher, extremely straight foward, class is open discussion. Definately plan on taking him again.
Professor Sullins is great! Lots of class discussion...I recommend flash cards for the key terms!!

Professor Sullins is a really nice and understanding teacher. He also has lots of great stories to tell. Be sure to bring your book to class because he reads and you highlight the stuff that will be on the test.
I took him spring 09..he was really passionate about juveniles as delinquents. He was interesting and he gives the test answers through highlighting. IT was easy but still interesting!!
really simple class, easy to make an A
